Methods

Analyze()

Get tokens from text analysis. The analyze API performs analysis on a text string and returns the resulting tokens.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual AnalyzeIndexResponse Analyze()

Returns

AnalyzeIndexResponse

Analyze(AnalyzeIndexRequest)

Get tokens from text analysis. The analyze API performs analysis on a text string and returns the resulting tokens.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

ClearCache()

Clears the caches of one or more indices. For data streams, the API clears the caches of the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ClearCacheResponse ClearCache()

Returns

ClearCacheResponse

ClearCache(ClearCacheRequest)

Clears the caches of one or more indices. For data streams, the API clears the caches of the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ClearCacheResponse ClearCache(ClearCacheRequest request)

Returns

Clears the caches of one or more indices. For data streams, the API clears the caches of the stream’s backing indices.

Delete an alias. Removes a data stream or index from an alias.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

DeleteIndexTemplate(DeleteIndexTemplateRequest)

Delete an index template. The provided <index-template> may contain multiple template names separated by a comma. If multiple template names are specified then there is no wildcard support and the provided names should match completely with existing templates.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual DeleteIndexTemplateResponse DeleteIndexTemplate(DeleteIndexTemplateRequest request)

Parameters

request DeleteIndexTemplateRequest

Returns

Downsample(DownsampleConfig, IndexName, IndexName)

Aggregates a time series (TSDS) index and stores pre-computed statistical summaries (min, max, sum, value_count and avg) for each metric field grouped by a configured time interval.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual DownsampleResponse Downsample(DownsampleConfig config, IndexName index, IndexName targetIndex)

Parameters

config DownsampleConfig
index IndexName
targetIndex IndexName

Returns

DownsampleResponse

Downsample(DownsampleConfig, IndexName, IndexName, Action<DownsampleRequestDescriptor>)

Aggregates a time series (TSDS) index and stores pre-computed statistical summaries (min, max, sum, value_count and avg) for each metric field grouped by a configured time interval.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual DownsampleResponse Downsample(DownsampleConfig config, IndexName index, IndexName targetIndex, Action<DownsampleRequestDescriptor> configureRequest)

Parameters

config DownsampleConfig
index IndexName
targetIndex IndexName
configureRequest Action<DownsampleRequestDescriptor>

Returns

DownsampleResponse

Downsample(DownsampleRequest)

Aggregates a time series (TSDS) index and stores pre-computed statistical summaries (min, max, sum, value_count and avg) for each metric field grouped by a configured time interval.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual DownsampleResponse Downsample(DownsampleRequest request)

Parameters

request DownsampleRequest

Returns

DownsampleResponse

Downsample(DownsampleRequestDescriptor)

Aggregates a time series (TSDS) index and stores pre-computed statistical summaries (min, max, sum, value_count and avg) for each metric field grouped by a configured time interval.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual DownsampleResponse Downsample(DownsampleRequestDescriptor descriptor)

Parameters

descriptor DownsampleRequestDescriptor

Returns

DownsampleResponse

DownsampleAsync(DownsampleConfig, IndexName, IndexName, Action<DownsampleRequestDescriptor>, CancellationToken)

Aggregates a time series (TSDS) index and stores pre-computed statistical summaries (min, max, sum, value_count and avg) for each metric field grouped by a configured time interval.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

Exists<TDocument>(Action<ExistsRequestDescriptor<TDocument>>)

Check indices. Checks if one or more indices, index aliases, or data streams exist.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ExistsResponse Exists<TDocument>(Action<ExistsRequestDescriptor<TDocument>> configureRequest)

Parameters

configureRequest Action<ExistsRequestDescriptor<TDocument>>

Returns

ExistsResponse

Type Parameters

TDocument

ExplainDataLifecycle(ExplainDataLifecycleRequest)

Get the status for a data stream lifecycle. Retrieves information about an index or data stream’s current data stream lifecycle status, such as time since index creation, time since rollover, the lifecycle configuration managing the index, or any errors encountered during lifecycle execution.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ExplainDataLifecycleResponse ExplainDataLifecycle(ExplainDataLifecycleRequest request)

Parameters

request ExplainDataLifecycleRequest

Returns

ExplainDataLifecycleResponse

Get(GetIndexRequest)

Get index information. Returns information about one or more indices. For data streams, the API returns information about the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual GetIndexResponse Get<TDocument>(Action<GetIndexRequestDescriptor<TDocument>> configureRequest)

Parameters

configureRequest Action<GetIndexRequestDescriptor<TDocument>>

Returns

GetIndexResponse

Type Parameters

TDocument

MigrateToDataStream(MigrateToDataStreamRequest)

Convert an index alias to a data stream. Converts an index alias to a data stream. You must have a matching index template that is data stream enabled. The alias must meet the following criteria: The alias must have a write index; All indices for the alias must have a @timestamp field mapping of a date or date_nanos field type; The alias must not have any filters; The alias must not use custom routing. If successful, the request removes the alias and creates a data stream with the same name. The indices for the alias become hidden backing indices for the stream. The write index for the alias becomes the write index for the stream.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual MigrateToDataStreamResponse MigrateToDataStream(MigrateToDataStreamRequest request)

Parameters

request MigrateToDataStreamRequest

Returns

MigrateToDataStreamResponse

MigrateToDataStream(MigrateToDataStreamRequestDescriptor)

Convert an index alias to a data stream. Converts an index alias to a data stream. You must have a matching index template that is data stream enabled. The alias must meet the following criteria: The alias must have a write index; All indices for the alias must have a @timestamp field mapping of a date or date_nanos field type; The alias must not have any filters; The alias must not use custom routing. If successful, the request removes the alias and creates a data stream with the same name. The indices for the alias become hidden backing indices for the stream. The write index for the alias becomes the write index for the stream.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual MigrateToDataStreamResponse MigrateToDataStream(MigrateToDataStreamRequestDescriptor descriptor)

Parameters

descriptor MigrateToDataStreamRequestDescriptor

Returns

Convert an index alias to a data stream. Converts an index alias to a data stream. You must have a matching index template that is data stream enabled. The alias must meet the following criteria: The alias must have a write index; All indices for the alias must have a @timestamp field mapping of a date or date_nanos field type; The alias must not have any filters; The alias must not use custom routing. If successful, the request removes the alias and creates a data stream with the same name. The indices for the alias become hidden backing indices for the stream. The write index for the alias becomes the write index for the stream.

Convert an index alias to a data stream. Converts an index alias to a data stream. You must have a matching index template that is data stream enabled. The alias must meet the following criteria: The alias must have a write index; All indices for the alias must have a @timestamp field mapping of a date or date_nanos field type; The alias must not have any filters; The alias must not use custom routing. If successful, the request removes the alias and creates a data stream with the same name. The indices for the alias become hidden backing indices for the stream. The write index for the alias becomes the write index for the stream.

Convert an index alias to a data stream. Converts an index alias to a data stream. You must have a matching index template that is data stream enabled. The alias must meet the following criteria: The alias must have a write index; All indices for the alias must have a @timestamp field mapping of a date or date_nanos field type; The alias must not have any filters; The alias must not use custom routing. If successful, the request removes the alias and creates a data stream with the same name. The indices for the alias become hidden backing indices for the stream. The write index for the alias becomes the write index for the stream.

OpenAsync(Indices, Action<OpenIndexRequestDescriptor>, CancellationToken)

Opens a closed index. For data streams, the API opens any closed backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

PutMapping(PutMappingRequest)

Update field mappings. Adds new fields to an existing data stream or index. You can also use this API to change the search settings of existing fields. For data streams, these changes are applied to all backing indices by default.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual PutMappingResponse PutMapping(PutMappingRequest request)

Parameters

request PutMappingRequest

Returns

PutMappingResponse

PutMapping(PutMappingRequestDescriptor)

Update field mappings. Adds new fields to an existing data stream or index. You can also use this API to change the search settings of existing fields. For data streams, these changes are applied to all backing indices by default.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual PutMappingResponse PutMapping(PutMappingRequestDescriptor descriptor)

Parameters

descriptor PutMappingRequestDescriptor

Returns

PutMappingResponse

Update field mappings. Adds new fields to an existing data stream or index. You can also use this API to change the search settings of existing fields. For data streams, these changes are applied to all backing indices by default.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

Parameters

request PutMappingRequest
cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task<PutMappingResponse>

PutMappingAsync(PutMappingRequestDescriptor, CancellationToken)

Update field mappings. Adds new fields to an existing data stream or index. You can also use this API to change the search settings of existing fields. For data streams, these changes are applied to all backing indices by default.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

descriptor PutMappingRequestDescriptor
cancellationToken CancellationToken

Type Parameters

TDocument

Recovery()

Returns information about ongoing and completed shard recoveries for one or more indices. For data streams, the API returns information for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual RecoveryResponse Recovery()

Returns

RecoveryResponse

Recovery(RecoveryRequest)

Returns information about ongoing and completed shard recoveries for one or more indices. For data streams, the API returns information for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]

Task<RecoveryResponse>

RecoveryAsync(CancellationToken)

Returns information about ongoing and completed shard recoveries for one or more indices. For data streams, the API returns information for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

public virtual Task<RecoveryResponse> RecoveryAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Refresh()

Refresh an index. A refresh makes recent operations performed on one or more indices available for search. For data streams, the API runs the refresh operation on the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]

ResolveCluster(ResolveClusterRequest)

Resolves the specified index expressions to return information about each cluster, including the local cluster, if included. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ResolveClusterResponse ResolveCluster(ResolveClusterRequest request)

Parameters

request ResolveClusterRequest

Returns

ResolveClusterResponse

ResolveCluster(ResolveClusterRequestDescriptor)

Resolves the specified index expressions to return information about each cluster, including the local cluster, if included. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ResolveClusterResponse ResolveCluster(ResolveClusterRequestDescriptor descriptor)

Parameters

descriptor ResolveClusterRequestDescriptor

Returns

ResolveClusterResponse

Resolves the specified index expressions to return information about each cluster, including the local cluster, if included. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

public virtual ResolveClusterResponse ResolveCluster(Names name)

name Names

ResolveIndex(ResolveIndexRequest)

Resolves the specified name(s) and/or index patterns for indices, aliases, and data streams. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ResolveIndexResponse ResolveIndex(ResolveIndexRequest request)

Parameters

request ResolveIndexRequest

Returns

ResolveIndexResponse

ResolveIndex(ResolveIndexRequestDescriptor)

Resolves the specified name(s) and/or index patterns for indices, aliases, and data streams. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

descriptor ResolveIndexRequestDescriptor

public virtual ResolveIndexResponse ResolveIndex(Names name)

Parameters

Returns

ResolveIndexResponse

ResolveIndex(Names, Action<ResolveIndexRequestDescriptor>)

Resolves the specified name(s) and/or index patterns for indices, aliases, and data streams. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ResolveIndexResponse ResolveIndex(Names name, Action<ResolveIndexRequestDescriptor> configureRequest)

Parameters

name Names
configureRequest Action<ResolveIndexRequestDescriptor>

Returns

ResolveIndexResponse

ResolveIndexAsync(ResolveIndexRequest, CancellationToken)

Resolves the specified name(s) and/or index patterns for indices, aliases, and data streams. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

public virtual Task<ResolveIndexResponse> ResolveIndexAsync(ResolveIndexRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

request ResolveIndexRequest
cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task<ResolveIndexResponse>

ResolveIndexAsync(ResolveIndexRequestDescriptor, CancellationToken)

Resolves the specified name(s) and/or index patterns for indices, aliases, and data streams. Multiple patterns and remote clusters are supported.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

Rollover(IndexAlias)

Roll over to a new index. Creates a new index for a data stream or index alias.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

Segments()

Returns low-level information about the Lucene segments in index shards. For data streams, the API returns information about the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual SegmentsResponse Segments()

Returns

ShardStores()

Retrieves store information about replica shards in one or more indices. For data streams, the API retrieves store information for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual ShardStoresResponse ShardStores()

Returns

ShardStoresResponse

Retrieves store information about replica shards in one or more indices. For data streams, the API retrieves store information for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.

ShardStoresAsync<TDocument>(Indices?, CancellationToken)

Retrieves store information about replica shards in one or more indices. For data streams, the API retrieves store information for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

public virtual Task<ShardStoresResponse> ShardStoresAsync<TDocument>(Indices? indices, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

indices Indices
cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

public virtual SplitIndexResponse Split<TDocument>(IndexName index, IndexName target)

Parameters

index IndexName
target IndexName

Returns

SplitIndexResponse

Type Parameters

TDocument

Split<TDocument>(IndexName, IndexName, Action<SplitIndexRequestDescriptor<TDocument>>)

Splits an existing index into a new index with more primary shards.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation. 

[Obsolete("Synchronous methods are deprecated and could be removed in the future.")]
public virtual SplitIndexResponse Split<TDocument>(IndexName index, IndexName target, Action<SplitIndexRequestDescriptor<TDocument>> configureRequest)

Parameters

index IndexName
target IndexName
configureRequest Action<SplitIndexRequestDescriptor<TDocument>>

Returns

TDocument

Stats()

Returns statistics for one or more indices. For data streams, the API retrieves statistics for the stream’s backing indices.

Learn more about this API in the Elasticsearch documentation.
